titleStmt.title: The great Turks terrible challenge, this yeare 1640. Pronounced against the Emperour of Germany and the King of Poland by Soloma Hometh who lately deceased, but continued by his brother Ibraim, the first of that name. To the tune of My bleeding heart, or Lets to the wars againe.
titleStmt.author: Süleyman I, Sultan of the Turks, 1494 or 5-1566.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Richard Harper at the Bible [and Harp in Smithfield,

notesStmt.note: Attributed by STC to Süleyman I (The Magnificent).
Verse: "You that ocurs strange newes to heare ..."
In two parts, printed side by side.
At head of second part: The second part to the same tune·
Imperfect: mutilated, affecting text, imprint, and ill..
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
